lead_paragraph: Slew o’Gold, a champion 3-year-old colt who went on to sire 28 stakes winners, has died at Three Chimneys Farm in Midway, Ky. He was 27. Slew o’Gold, part of the first crop from the 1977 Triple Crown winner Seattle Slew, was euthanized Sunday because of old age. Slew o’Gold won 12 of 21 starts during his three-year career, including the Jockey Club Gold Cup and the Wood Memorial in 1983.
